title: I am planning to open an online bookstore. How do I get books and from whom? If my book is not sold will the publisher return the books? - Quora

response.answer_text: You will have to contact various publishers and get an account with them.Some of them are quite open with direct accounting some do it through distributors ( but by contacting they tell you who their best distributors are )There are many distributors who are quite good with Ecommerce supplies; & they too keep the books stocked ( majorly they be the beatsellers ) like IBD; Prakash etc. Via. Distri. Your direct billing won't happen with publisher. Even if you will send the POs to publisher the order consignment will be sent to distributor with your reference some also do 'bill to distri. Ship to you'  + edit: about returns , mainly you get stocks on SOR basis on direct accounting with publishers only (& in that too majorly trade books are accepted in SOR; non trade publishers might not easily do it) There are many ways to get stock.

1. Find out the major book distributors in your country, including distributors of imported books. Similarly find out major publishers who may look for a distribution partner.2. Start a dialogue, negotiate contracts. You second concern can be put forward in the negotiation. Normally book industry takes back unsold stuff in most agreements. It won't be hard to negotiate.
